monogr.title: Satyræ seriæ: or, The secrets of things : written in morall and politicke observations

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p:
SOME advise to put ones Thoughts into VVords, lest they prove ungratefull & smother their owner:
Others to put a Mans Words into Writing, lest they passe for what they are not: So that like unto those I have unfolded my thoughts, to see what complexion they are of in the open light; since nothing is more preiudiciall to a discreet value of things, than to see them at halfe and counterfeit shadows.
I have not delivered them with insinuations, or advantages of Art, for Essaies are but the Images of affaires, which being quickned with the life and vigour of profit or pleasure, may adde motion to your liking: and these are only Speeches, the representation of mens thoughts, and therefore may challenge an
easier accesse unto them, being of their owne nature insinuating, and returning into Mens bosomes, whence they came.
